intro: Blysmus tenuis, commonly known as the slender blysmus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its fine, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in open, sunny habitats. Its slender stems and small, narrow leaves are adapted to arid conditions. Blysmus tenuis produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer.
